episodes.name: Side Quest: Song and Dance
episodes.overview: Phil, the art director of MQ, attempts to enjoy a Hawaiian vacation with his girlfriend while dealing with increasingly invasive calls from Ian Grimm.

episodes.name: Side Quest: Pull List
episodes.overview: When a Black-owned comic book shop receives only one copy of the latest MQ comic, five superfans fight over who deserves it the most.

episodes.name: Side Quest: Fugue
episodes.overview: A young cellist joins a touring video game orchestra, only to discover what happens when your dream job becomes a nightmare.

episodes.name: Side Quest: The Last Raid
episodes.overview: Five high school friends in a long-running MQ guild discover a glitch that might break the game—or their friendship.

episodes.name: Heaven and Hell (Original Cut)
episodes.overview: An unexpected visitor from Montreal evaluates MQ. Ian and Poppy face a pivotal decision. The original season finale cut serves as the alternate cut according to Apple+ current lineup.

episodes.name: Pilot
episodes.overview: As the hit video game Mythic Quest prepares to launch its newest update, creator Ian Grimm obsesses over a seemingly minor detail.

episodes.name: The Casino
episodes.overview: Brad takes the day off to prove a point, leaving Poppy and David to keep the game afloat. Dana and Rachel have a girls’ night in.

episodes.name: Dinner Party
episodes.overview: The development team must take decisive action when the internet discovers a dark group of gamers congregating in Mythic Quest.

episodes.name: The Convention
episodes.overview: When Pootie_Shoe announces that he’s no longer playing Mythic Quest, the team needs to find a new star streamer to promote it.

episodes.name: A Dark Quiet Death
episodes.overview: From inception to demise, the life cycle of video game Dark Quiet Death.

episodes.name: Non-Player Character
episodes.overview: Poppy steps out for a meeting and Mythic Quest headquarters descends into chaos.

episodes.name: Permadeath
episodes.overview: Ian challenges a hacker to an epic in-game showdown.

episodes.name: Brendan
episodes.overview: As Poppy weighs a difficult decision, Ian whisks her away on a mysterious road trip.

episodes.name: Blood Ocean
episodes.overview: With his workforce unionizing, Ian faces a looming departure, the game’s future, and the meaning of two words: Blood Ocean.

episodes.name: Quarantine
episodes.overview: As the MQ staff works from home, Poppy struggles with solitude while Brad and David start a charitable competition.

episodes.name: Everlight
episodes.overview: The team returns to the office for their annual Everlight party. Poppy and Ian rig a LARP tournament in an underdog's favor.

episodes.name: Titans’ Rift
episodes.overview: With Ian on sabbatical, Poppy must come up with a title for the new expansion. Dana and Rachel take their relationship to new heights.

episodes.name: Grouchy Goat
episodes.overview: Brad wants to launch a mobile game. Poppy is pulled away from working on the expansion with Ian to speak at a luncheon for women in gaming.

episodes.name: #YumYum
episodes.overview: Ian and Poppy work separately on the expansion, Jo helps C.W. deal with his publisher, and Brad sets out to find a romantic partner for David.

episodes.name: Breaking Brad
episodes.overview: Brad attempts to convince the development team that his brother Zack is not the nice guy he’s pretending to be. Rachel does Ian a favor.

episodes.name: Please Sign Here
episodes.overview: Carol tries to wrangle Mythic Quest employees as they refuse to sign the results of a simple workplace assessment.

episodes.name: Backstory!
episodes.overview: A fresh-faced young man discovers what it takes to become one of the world’s greatest science fiction writers.

episodes.name: Peter
episodes.overview: Rachel accompanies C.W. on an acrimonious visit to his former friend turned rival.

episodes.name: Juice Box
episodes.overview: Ian presents his half of the expansion and ends up in the hospital. David ponders his legacy.

episodes.name: TBD
episodes.overview: Ian and Poppy collaborate again, Rachel and Dana figure out their next move, and Brad looks to settle a feud once and for all.

episodes.name: Across the Universe
episodes.overview: As David stewards Mythic Quest, Ian and Poppy consider offers for their offshoot game. Jo assembles the entire team for C.W.’s celebration.

episodes.name: Partners
episodes.overview: Ian feels adrift in his new partnership with Poppy. David and Jo are suspicious of an employee’s return. Dana and Rachel meet the new testers.

episodes.name: Crushing It
episodes.overview: David uses exciting news about MQ to make Ian jealous. Poppy, Rachel, and Jo go to brunch.

episodes.name: The Two Joes
episodes.overview: When David gets stuck in traffic, Jo takes his place to meet with a famous actor for the movie. Brad tries to help Carol raise money through NFTs.

episodes.name: Playpen
episodes.overview: Poppy begrudgingly takes feedback from Dana about her work. Carol, Brad, and Rachel navigate the aftermath of their monetization gambit.

episodes.name: The 12 Hours of Christmas
episodes.overview: In the first holiday season since Ian and Poppy’s departure, David grabs the reins and tries to infuse the team with Christmas spirit.

episodes.name: Sarian
episodes.overview: Two kids from across the globe find their passions in a world that doesn’t understand them.

episodes.name: To Catch a Mouse
episodes.overview: Ian’s and Poppy’s clashing office preferences put them at odds. Jo and Brad team up to get rid of a pest in David’s office.

episodes.name: The Year of Phil
episodes.overview: David’s motion-capture session with Joe Manganiello gets hijacked. Dana helps Poppy prepare her PlayPen VC pitch.

episodes.name: Buffalo Chicken Pizza
episodes.overview: Ian tries to repair his partnership with Poppy. David hits an impasse with the movie. Dana has a realization about Grimpop.

episodes.name: Boundaries
episodes.overview: Ian and Poppy reveal their project as they struggle with personal and professional lines. The Mythic Quest team adjusts to their new game’s growth.
David uses AI to help regulate gamer behavior—then needs humans to regulate the AI. Meanwhile, no one is regulating Ian and Poppy’s arguments.

episodes.name: Breakthrough
episodes.overview: Ian, David, and Jo embark on a day of self-discovery. Brad teaches Dana and Rachel about financial responsibility.

episodes.name: The Villain’s Feast
episodes.overview: A mysterious host invites the MQ team to a glamorous murder mystery party on a private island.

episodes.name: Second Skeleton
episodes.overview: Poppy grapples with a discovery as Ian tries to help in his own unique way. Dana runs into unexpected competition.

episodes.name: The Fish and the Whale
episodes.overview: When Dana’s plans for a new game are threatened by her ties to MQ, Brad devises a long con to help her. Jo throws Poppy a party.

episodes.name: The Room Where It Happens
episodes.overview: David and Rachel face scrutiny over Playpen. Dana makes a difficult decision. Ian’s attempt to help Poppy doesn’t go as planned.

episodes.name: Rebrand
episodes.overview: Pootie_Shoe attempts to rebrand himself by challenging a rival to an MMA fight.

episodes.name: Telephone
episodes.overview: As Poppy considers a major life change, David scrambles to keep MQ afloat.

episodes.name: Heaven and Hell
episodes.overview: An unexpected visitor from Montreal evaluates MQ. Ian and Poppy face a pivotal decision. The updated ending from April 18, 2025 is what Apple TV+ lists as the official series finale after the show's cancelation.
